messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM On Wed, Apr 3, 2013 at 3:37 PM, wrote: > Reviewers: golang-dev1, > > Message: > Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, > > I'd like you to review this change to > https://code.google.com/p/go/ > > > Description: > doc: fix typos in go1.1 > > Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/8342044/ > > Affected files: > M doc/go1.1.html > > > Index: doc/go1.1.html > ==============================**==============================**======= > --- a/doc/go1.1.html > +++ b/doc/go1.1.html > @@ -291,7 +291,7 @@ > A major addition to the tools is a race detector, a way to find > bugs in programs caused by problems like concurrent changes to the same > variable. > This new facility is built into the go tool. > -To enable it, set the the -race flag when building or > testing your program > +To enable it, set the -race flag when building or testing > your program > (for instance, go test -race). > The race detector is documented in a > separate article. >

> @@ -968,7 +968,7 @@ > TrimPrefix > and > TrimSuffix > -with self-evident properties, and the the new method > +with self-evident properties, and the new method > Reader.WriteTo<**/code> > so the > <**code>Reader > type now implements the > > > -- > > ---You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google > Groups "golang-dev" group. > To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an > email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@**googlegroups.com > . > For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/**groups/opt_out > . > > >

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=d646225cb410 ***

doc: fix typos in go1.1

R=golang-dev, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/8342044

subject: code review 8342044: doc: fix typos in go1.1
